verses.verse: <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, you have been <S%H7521>favorable<s%> unto your <S%H776>land<s%>: you have brought <S%H7725>back<s%> the <S%H7622>captivity<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>.
You have <S%H5375>forgiven<s%> the <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> of your <S%H5971>people<s%>, you have <S%H3680>covered<s%> all their <S%H2403>sin<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.
You have taken <S%H622>away<s%> all your <S%H5678>wrath<s%>: you have <S%H7725>turned<s%> yourself from the <S%H2740>fierceness<s%> of your <S%H639>anger<s%>.
<S%H7725>Turn<s%> <S%H430>us<s%>, O God of our <S%H3468>salvation<s%>, and cause your <S%H3708>anger<s%> toward us to <S%H6565>cease<s%>.
Will you be <S%H599>angry<s%> with us for <S%H5769>ever<s%>? will you draw <S%H4900>out<s%> your <S%H639>anger<s%> to <S%H1755>all<s%> <S%H1755>generations<s%>?
Will you not <S%H2421>revive<s%> us <S%H7725>again<s%>: that your <S%H5971>people<s%> may rejoice in <S%H8055>you<s%>?
<S%H7200>Show<s%> us your <S%H2617>mercy<s%>, O <S%H3068>Lord<s%>, and <S%H5414>grant<s%> us your <S%H3468>salvation<s%>.

I will <S%H8085>hear<s%> what <S%H410>God<s%> the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> will <S%H1696>speak<s%>: for he will <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H7965>peace<s%> unto his <S%H5971>people<s%>, and to his <S%H2623>saints<s%>: but let them not turn <S%H7725>again<s%> to <S%H3690>wickedness<s%>.
Surely his <S%H3468>salvation<s%> is <S%H7138>near<s%> them that <S%H3373>fear<s%> <S%H3519>him<s%>; that glory may <S%H7931>live<s%> in our <S%H776>land<s%>.
<S%H2617>Mercy<s%> and <S%H571>truth<s%> are met <S%H6298>together<s%>; <S%H6664>righteousness<s%> and <S%H7965>peace<s%> have kissed each <S%H5401>other<s%>.
<S%H571>Truth<s%> shall spring <S%H6779>out<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>; and <S%H6664>righteousness<s%> shall look <S%H8259>down<s%> from <S%H8064>heaven<s%>.
<S%H3068>Yes<s%>, the Lord shall <S%H5414>give<s%> that which is <S%H2896>good<s%>; and our <S%H776>land<s%> shall <S%H5414>yield<s%> her <S%H2981>increase<s%>.
<S%H6664>Righteousness<s%> shall <S%H1980>go<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H7760>him<s%>; and shall set us in the <S%H1870>way<s%> of his <S%H6471>steps<s%>.
